archetype.archetype_expression: The knowledgeable expert who makes complex technology feel approachable. Commands respect through expertise but never condescends. Organized, thorough, and genuinely helpful. The friend who works in tech and actually explains things clearly.

soul.one_sentence: Your trusted tech-savvy friend who makes smart home complexity feel like common sense.
soul.expanded: We cut through the confusion of smart home technology. No jargon without explanation, no affiliate-driven recommendations, no assumption that you already know what you're doing. Every guide is written by someone who's actually set these things up and knows where the gotchas hide.
soul.what_we_are: The expert friend everyone wishes they had. Clear explanations of complex topics. Honest recommendations. Practical guides that actually work.
soul.what_we_are_not: Not a spec sheet database. Not a paid review site. Not assuming you're an IT professional. Not condescending to beginners.

if_this_site_were.person: A 35-year-old senior engineer who genuinely enjoys helping people. Probably has a home lab, definitely has opinions about WiFi mesh systems. Wears comfortable clothes, drinks good coffee, and can explain quantum computing to your grandmother if needed. Patient but efficient.
if_this_site_were.place: A clean, well-organized home office with multiple monitors, smart devices visible but not cluttered. Good lighting, ergonomic setup. The kind of space where things work properly because someone took the time to set them up right.
if_this_site_were.time_of_day: Mid-morning on a Saturday—energized, focused, productive time. Coffee in hand, ready to tackle projects.
if_this_site_were.season: Spring—fresh start energy, time to upgrade and improve.
if_this_site_were.sound: Mechanical keyboard clicks. A home assistant occasionally responding. The hum of well-maintained equipment. No chaos, no noise.
if_this_site_were.texture: Smooth aluminum devices. Clean glass screens. Quality plastics. The satisfying click of well-designed buttons.
if_this_site_were.smell: Fresh coffee. Clean electronics. Perhaps a hint of the outdoors through an automatically-opened window.
if_this_site_were.taste: Quality coffee. Clean water from a filtered smart faucet. Nothing complicated.
if_this_site_were.weather: Clear and connected—good signal, no interference.
if_this_site_were.music_genre: Lo-fi productivity beats or ambient electronic. Unobtrusive, focused.
if_this_site_were.movie: Her meets Iron Man—technology that serves humans, sophisticated but approachable.
if_this_site_were.book: A really well-written technical manual that you actually enjoy reading. Clear diagrams, practical examples, no fluff.

primary_persona.name: Setup Steve
primary_persona.description: A homeowner who's bought some smart devices but now realizes it's more complicated than the box suggested. Reasonably tech-literate but not an expert. Has a decent job, can afford quality, and values things working properly.
primary_persona.mindset: Solution-oriented, willing to learn, wants things to work right the first time. Values expertise but hates being talked down to.
goals: Not waste money on wrong products
pain_points: Hard to know what's actually good
objections: Is this site going to recommend expensive stuff just for affiliate money?
Will this actually work with what I have?
trigger_phrases: how to set up smart home

secondary_persona.name: Upgrading Uma
secondary_persona.description: Already has a working smart home but wants to optimize, expand, or upgrade. Knows the basics, wants advanced tips and honest comparisons.
secondary_persona.how_they_differ: Needs depth over basics, wants edge cases and advanced scenarios

tertiary_persona.name: Research Rachel
tertiary_persona.description: Considering smart home but hasn't started. Doing research, comparing options, needs the big picture before diving in.
tertiary_persona.how_they_differ: Needs overview content, 'where to start' guidance, budget planning

anti_persona.description: Someone who just wants the cheapest option regardless of quality. Someone expecting magic solutions without any learning. Extreme DIY-ers who want to build everything from scratch.
anti_persona.why_not: We prioritize value and reliability over cheapest price. We require some reader engagement. We focus on consumer solutions, not custom builds.

density.description: Efficient but not cramped. Information-rich without overwhelming.
density.section_breathing: Clear separation between topics. Information grouped logically.
density.never: Never cluttered. Never wall-of-specs. Never information overload.

contrast.description: Clean contrast for readability. Light mode primary, dark mode supported.
contrast.approach: High contrast text on clean backgrounds. Clear hierarchy through weight and size.
contrast.drama_level: Low drama—let the content be the focus, not the design.
contrast.never: Never low-contrast trendy gray. Never dramatic for drama's sake.

motion.description: Quick, purposeful, efficient. Technology should feel responsive.
motion.style: Ease-out, responsive feel. Things happen when you want them to.
motion.frequency: Functional motion only. Hover states, reveals, navigation.
motion.purpose: To indicate interaction and state change, not decoration
motion.never: Never slow. Never bouncy. Never gratuitous. Never delayed.

texture.description: Clean and minimal. Let products and content provide visual interest.
texture.never: Never grungy. Never skeuomorphic. Never paper textures.

shape_language.primary_shapes: Clean rectangles with slight rounding. Modern but not trendy.
shape_language.line_weight: Medium—1-2px borders, clear but not heavy
shape_language.never: Never fully rounded pills. Never sharp 0-radius. Never inconsistent.

depth.approach: Subtle elevation for hierarchy. Cards float slightly.
depth.shadow_style: Soft, small shadows. Functional not decorative.
depth.never: Never material design extremes. Never heavy drop shadows.

required_flow: Clear value proposition hero—what we help with

hero_requirements.type: Clean, purposeful, not full-screen (users want content)
hero_requirements.content_placement: Clear headline, brief value prop, search or category entry
hero_requirements.cta_style: Clear paths: Search, Browse Categories, or Start Here

category_pages.featured_treatment: Best/most useful content highlighted at top

single_posts.layout_type: Single column with optional sidebar for navigation
single_posts.sidebar_usage: Sticky ToC for long guides, related content for shorter posts

grid_philosophy.grid_breaking: Featured content can span full width

spacing_rhythm.breathing_rule: Enough space to scan easily, not so much it feels empty

responsive_philosophy.mobile_approach: Stack cleanly, maintain readability, touch-friendly targets

primary_nav.item_naming_style: Clear and descriptive. Users should know what they'll find.
primary_nav.dropdown_behavior: Clean dropdowns with subcategories. Mega menu if needed for large categories.

breadcrumbs.style: Clear path: Home > Category > Subcategory > Post

search.prominence: Prominent—users often know what they need
search.style: Search bar visible in header, predictive suggestions

headings.personality: Clean, modern, professional. Clear hierarchy without being cold.
headings.text_transform: None typically, occasional all-caps for labels

body.personality: Highly readable, professional, comfortable for long reads

accent.usage: Code snippets, technical specs, model numbers

accent.name: Alert Orange
accent.max_usage: Less than 5% - only when attention needed

photography_style.color_treatment: Accurate colors—people need to see what products actually look like

illustration_style.approach: Clean diagrams, system architecture visuals, comparison charts
illustration_style.style_reference: Apple product diagrams, Google's material illustrations

iconography.style: Clean line icons, consistent stroke width
iconography.icon_library: Phosphor Icons or Lucide (customized to brand colors)

image_treatment.overlays: None typically—let products be seen clearly
image_treatment.borders: Subtle border or shadow for definition
image_treatment.shapes: Clean rectangles, rounded corners matching brand radius
image_treatment.hover_effects: Subtle shadow increase or brightness adjustment

must_include.description: Visual indicator of ecosystem compatibility (Alexa, Google, HomeKit, etc.)

usage_rules.max_per_page: As many as helpful—these are functional
usage_rules.placement: Where they provide value to readers
usage_rules.restraint_philosophy: Functional elements should be common. Decorative elements should be rare.

custom_ui_elements.cards: Clean with clear hierarchy, product image prominent
custom_ui_elements.dividers: Simple lines or whitespace, never decorative
custom_ui_elements.loading_states: Simple spinner or skeleton, fast resolution

writing_style.sentence_length: Clear and direct. Complex when necessary, simple when possible.
writing_style.paragraph_length: 2-4 sentences. Break up dense technical info.
writing_style.vocabulary_level: Technical terms used but always explained on first use

voice.perspective: Second person (you) for guides, first person plural (we) for recommendations
forbidden_phrases: At the end of the day
encouraged_phrases: Here's what you need to know

immediate_rejection_triggers: Looks like generic tech blog template
Could be any product review site

what_cheap_looks_like: Stock photos of people pointing at tablets
what_acceptable_looks_like: But generic—could be any tech site
what_perfect_looks_like: Products look better here than on Amazon
Readers feel more capable after reading
Would be cited as a quality example in the niche

tests.screenshot_test: Would someone researching smart homes trust this site at first glance?
tests.swap_test: Could this be mistaken for CNET or Tom's Guide? (Different, not generic)
tests.memory_test: After reading a guide, can someone actually do the thing?
tests.ten_second_test: Can a visitor find what they need within 10 seconds?

competitive_positioning.how_we_differ: More depth, less news churn, focused specifically on smart home (not all tech)
competitive_positioning.what_they_do_wrong: Too news-focused, not enough how-to depth, affiliate-driven recommendations
competitive_positioning.what_we_do_better: Genuine expertise, practical guides, honest recommendations, beginner-friendly

seo.internal_linking_strategy: Category hubs link to all related content. Guides link to product reviews. Reviews link back to guides.
seo.content_depth_target: Ultimate guides: 4000+, Standard guides: 2000+, Reviews: 1500+, Quick answers: 800+
